SENT.plain: We report the rare presentation of lacunar stroke syndrome secondary to single perforator mouth occlusion from radiation-induced middle cerebral artery (MCA) stem arteriopathy
A 30-year-old female had acute-onset right-sided ataxic hemiparesis and dysarthria
As a child, she had a medulloblastoma of the posterior fossa and had surgery followed by cranial radiotherapy
She had no significant vascular risk factors
Acute CT showed extensive bilateral basal ganglia and left thalamic calcification; DWI showed a left internal capsule lacunar infarct; and MRA and CTA showed a 50% stenosis of the proximal left MCA
